titleStmt.title: James H. Mullins and W. H. Kirtley to James F. Robinson
CWG8792

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: To his Excellency James F. Robinson Governor of Kentucky -- Your petitioner respectfully represents to your Excellency that that Just before the August Term of the Rockcastle Circuit Court 1861. he had collected a small debt due him in Whisky without any intention of retailing some, but being called on by a neighbor who represented that his family was sick and as a matter of Kindness he let him have one quart and at the last Feby Term; he was fined $20 & costs. He also states that on account of high water he could not get to Court & and Judgt went by default -- The premises considered he asks that your Excellency remit said fine except fees & cots.

Apl 1st 1863. Jas H Mullins
W H. Kirtley

Thomas farley 1
John A Dams 2
SpenCer ordery 4
William M Mullins 6
David owens 53
Abner McHenry 6
Gardner G Mullins
Balbirger Mullins
R, Singleton
J Owens
Wesley Owens
John C L Mullins
Richard Wilson
R, P, Gresham
Jas. H. Mullins of Rockcastle County pettn to remit fine
